item.title: Revisiting using a Content Security Policy (CSP) nonce in Blazor
item.description: This blog looks at implementing a strong Content Security Policy (CSP) in web applications implemented using Blazor and ASP.NET Core. When implementing CSP, I always recommend using a CSP nonce or at least CSP hashes. If a technical stack does not support CSP nonces, you should probably avoid using this solution when implementing secure and [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://damienbod.com/2025/05/26/revisiting-using-a-content-security-policy-csp-nonce-in-blazor/

item.description: The article emphasizes the importance of proper input validation in software engineering, highlighting its role in preventing errors and maintaining data integrity. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/05/25/coding-faster-with-dotnettips-spargine-validating-arguments-made-easy-with-validator/

The default settings in OpenJDK are intentionally conservative, designed to work across [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/announcing-azure-command-launcher-for-java

item.title: Storing JSON data in relational databases using EF Core
